intro: Euonymus philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cistaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
